trans-unit.source: Writes a character string at a specified location and expanding tabs to the specified tab-stop positions

seg-source.mrk: Writes a character string at a specified location and expanding tabs to the specified tab-stop positions

target.mrk: Writes a character string at a specified location and expanding tabs to the specified tab-stop positions

trans-unit.source: Parameters
A handle to the device context.

seg-source.mrk: A handle to the device context.

target.mrk: A handle to the device context.

trans-unit.source: The x-coordinate of the starting point of the string, in logical units.

seg-source.mrk: The x-coordinate of the starting point of the string, in logical units.

target.mrk: The x-coordinate of the starting point of the string, in logical units.

trans-unit.source: The y-coordinate of the starting point of the string, in logical units.

seg-source.mrk: The y-coordinate of the starting point of the string, in logical units.

target.mrk: The y-coordinate of the starting point of the string, in logical units.

trans-unit.source: The character string to draw.
[optional] The array containing the tab-stop positions, in logical units. The tab stops must be sorted in increasing

The tab stops must be sorted in increasing

target.mrk: The array containing the tab-stop positions, in logical units.
The tab stops must be sorted in increasing

trans-unit.source: order; the smallest x-value should be the first item in the array. Also, it can be an integer value that is

trans-unit.source: one tab-stop position. In this case, the tab stops are separated by the distance specified by this value.

target.mrk: In this case, the tab stops are separated by the distance specified by this value.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0, tabs are expanded to eight times the average character width.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0, tabs are expanded to eight times the average character width.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0, tabs are expanded to eight times the average character width.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The index of array element that contains the first tab-stop position.

trans-unit.source: Return Value
Remarks
The string is written in the currently selected font, background color, and text color.

seg-source.mrk: The string is written in the currently selected font, background color, and text color.

target.mrk: The string is written in the currently selected font, background color, and text color.
